Package mz

Interface SortSwap<T extends Comparable>

Type Parameters:
T - when entering it, you can set which class type the interface is used as.
All Superinterfaces:
Sort<T>
All Known Subinterfaces:
HeapInterface<T>, Intro<T>, IntroDPQ<T>, QuickInterface<T>, SelectionInterface<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
Bubble, Cocktail, Comb, DoubleSelection, DualPivotQuick, Gnome, Heap, IntroAnother, IntroBubble, IntroCocktail, IntroComb, IntroDoubleSelection, IntroDPQAnother, IntroDPQBubble, IntroDPQCocktail, IntroDPQComb, IntroDPQDoubleSelection, IntroDPQDualPivotQuick, IntroDPQGnome, IntroDPQHeap, IntroDPQInsertion, IntroDPQMerge, IntroDPQMerge3, IntroDPQMergeInPlace, IntroDPQMergeInsertion, IntroDPQOddEven, IntroDPQQuick, IntroDPQQuick3, IntroDPQSelection, IntroDPQShell, IntroDPQSmoothHeap, IntroDPQStableQuick, IntroDPQTernaryHeap, IntroDPQTim, IntroDPQWeakHeap, IntroDPQWeaveMerge, IntroDPQWiki, IntroDualPivotQuick, IntroGnome, IntroHeap, IntroInsertion, IntroMerge, IntroMerge3, IntroMergeInPlace, IntroMergeInsertion, IntroOddEven, IntroQuick, IntroQuick3, IntroSelection, IntroShell, IntroSmoothHeap, IntroStableQuick, IntroTernaryHeap, IntroTim, IntroWeakHeap, IntroWeaveMerge, IntroWiki, OddEven, Quick, Quick3, Selection, SmoothHeap, StableQuick, TernaryHeap, WeakHeap
public interface SortSwap<T extends Comparable> extends Sort<T>
The inheritors of this interface arrange any data type that is T.
Since:
1.0

  • Method Details

    • swap

      default void swap(T[] array, int a, int b)
      Swaps two elements in the array. When implemented in other classes, they do not have to create a predefined method, overwriting is possible. 
       default void swap(T[] array, int a, int b) {
     T select = array[a];
     array[a] = array[b];
     array[b] = select;
 }
      Parameters:
      array - in which the two selected elements are swapped.
      a - element whose value will be changed to the value of element b.
      b - element whose value will be changed to the value of element a.

    • isSwapInc

      default boolean isSwapInc(T[] array, int i, int j)
      isSwapInc that checks if a swap operation is necessary between two elements in an array of Comparable objects in order to maintain the increasing order.
      • The method takes an array of Comparable objects, denoted by array, and the indices i and j of the two elements to be compared and potentially swapped.
      • The @SuppressWarnings("unchecked") annotation is used to suppress compiler warnings related to unchecked type casting when using the compareTo method. This annotation is not directly related to the functionality of the method but rather a way to handle warnings.
      • The variable swap is initially set to false, indicating that no swap operation has been performed yet.
      • The condition if (array[i].compareTo(array[(i + j)]) > 0) compares the elements at indices i and (i + j) in the array to check if a swap is necessary. If the element at index i is greater than the element at index (i + j), a swap operation is performed.
      • Inside the if block, the swap method is called to swap the elements at indices i and (i + j) in the array. After the swap, the swapped variable is set to true.
      • Finally, the method returns the value of swapped, indicating whether a swap operation was performed (true) or not (false).
      isSwapInc method can be used as a helper method in sorting algorithms to check if a swap is necessary between two elements in order to maintain the increasing order of the array.
      Parameters:
      array - to be arranged.
      i - elements to be compared
      j - elements to be compared
      Returns:
      the value of swapped.
      See Also:
      • swap(Comparable[], int, int)

    • isSwapDec

      default boolean isSwapDec(T[] array, int i, int j)
      isSwapDec that checks if a swap operation is necessary between two elements in an array of Comparable objects in order to maintain the increasing order.
      • The method takes an array of Comparable objects, denoted by array, and the indices i and j of the two elements to be compared and potentially swapped.
      • The @SuppressWarnings("unchecked") annotation is used to suppress compiler warnings related to unchecked type casting when using the compareTo method. This annotation is not directly related to the functionality of the method but rather a way to handle warnings.
      • The variable swap is initially set to false, indicating that no swap operation has been performed yet.
      • The condition if (array[i].compareTo(array[(i + j)]) < 0) compares the elements at indices i and (i + j) in the array to check if a swap is necessary. If the element at index i is smaller than the element at index (i + j), a swap operation is performed.
      • Inside the if block, the swap method is called to swap the elements at indices i and (i + j) in the array. After the swap, the swapped variable is set to true.
      • Finally, the method returns the value of swapped, indicating whether a swap operation was performed (true) or not (false).
      isSwapDec method can be used as a helper method in sorting algorithms to check if a swap is necessary between two elements in order to maintain the increasing order of the array.
      Parameters:
      array - to be arranged.
      i - elements to be compared
      j - elements to be compared
      Returns:
      the value of swapped.
      See Also:
      • swap(Comparable[], int, int)

    • flip

      default void flip(T[] array, int to)
      flip, which takes an array array and one indices to as input. It performs an in-place flipping of elements within the specified range of the array.
      • The method enters a while loop, which continues as long as the from index is 0, is less than the to index.
      • Inside the loop, the swap method is called to exchange the elements at indices from and to in the array. The swap method is assumed to be defined elsewhere, and it swaps the elements in-place.
      • After swapping the elements, the from index is incremented by one from++, and the to index is decremented by one to--.
      • The loop continues until the from index is no longer less than the to index, at which point the flipping is complete.
      flip method reverses the order of elements in the specified range of the array. It does this by swapping elements from the beginning and end of the range, gradually moving towards the middle until the entire range is flipped.
      Parameters:
      array - in which the two selected index are flip.
      to - is the index by which to finish the analyzed.
      See Also:
      • swap(Comparable[], int, int)

    • flip

      default void flip(T[] array, int from, int to)
      flip, which takes an array array and two indices from and to as input. It performs an in-place flipping of elements within the specified range of the array.
      • The method enters a while loop, which continues as long as the from index is less than the to index.
      • Inside the loop, the swap method is called to exchange the elements at indices from and to in the array. The swap method is assumed to be defined elsewhere, and it swaps the elements in-place.
      • After swapping the elements, the from index is incremented by one from++, and the to index is decremented by one to--.
      • The loop continues until the from index is no longer less than the to index, at which point the flipping is complete.
      flip method reverses the order of elements in the specified range of the array. It does this by swapping elements from the beginning and end of the range, gradually moving towards the middle until the entire range is flipped.
      Parameters:
      array - in which the two selected index are flip.
      from - is the index from which the analyzed should start.
      to - is the index by which to finish the analyzed.
      See Also:
      • swap(Comparable[], int, int)
